üö® $HYPE  held in Hyper‚Äôs Assistance Fund has been formally recognized as burned!  Quick context: ‚Ä¢ Trading fees are automatically converted into HYPE & sent to a system address with no private key, meaning the tokens were already inaccessible.  Validators voted to make this permanent.  Result: 85% approved.  Those HYPE tokens are now officially removed from supply. üëÄ

The Hyper Foundation burned 37M $HYPE  tokens (~$1B) after a Governance Vote.  Vote result: ‚úÖ 85% Yes | ‚ùå 7% No | ‚è∏ 8% abstain  Why this matters: 13%+ of circulating supply gone forever Tokens were locked in a system address (no private key) Validators agreed to never unlock or access them Trading fees auto-buy #HYPE  and get burned ~$874M fees generated this year, 99% used for buybacks  Less supply. Real fees. Long-term scarcity.  This is one of the Strongest Deflationary Moves in Crypto right now.  #HyperLiquid

üî• Hyper Foundation burned $HYPE  tokens from its Assistance Fund address üßØ  The governance vote approved a permanent supply reduction - those $HYPE  are gone from circulating supply for good. Less float can amplify moves if demand stays sticky.  Traders: watch how $HYPE  liquidity reacts vs $BTC .  What‚Äôs your read - bullish supply shock or already priced in? #HyperFoundation  #HYPE  #TokenBurn
üî• UPDATE: Hyper Foundation formally burns $HYPE  tokens from its Assistance Fund address following a governance vote, permanently removing them from circulating supply.

Validators have approved the permanent burn of around 37 million $HYPE   tokens to reduce supply and strengthen the token‚Äôs long-term value. Even with this move, the price dipped, showing that the market doesn‚Äôt always react immediately to good news.  #HYPE

üî• Hyper Foundation Confirms Permanent $HYPE   Token Burn The Hyper Foundation has officially confirmed a permanent burn of $HYPE   tokens following a successful governance vote. Validators approved the proposal with 85% in favor, formally recognizing tokens held in the Assistance Fund system address as permanently removed from supply. These tokens were already inaccessible, but the vote ensures they are now excluded from both circulating and total supply, bringing long-needed clarity to HYPE‚Äôs tokenomics.  This move reduces uncertainty around future supply and reinforces a scarcity-driven narrative for HYPE. While not a traditional on-chain burn, the governance-backed decision tightens supply metrics and strengthens transparency  a positive long-term signal as the ecosystem continues to mature. Observing Hyperliquid ( $HYPE) today as it holds its spot on the CoinMarketCap trending list. The price structure shows a period of consolidation after its recent expansion, with the $24.00 level acting as a psychological support while facing local resistance near $26.50.
‚ÄãTrading volume remains steady, though momentum has flattened slightly as the market digests the initial airdrop and mainnet launch excitement. It‚Äôs likely trending due to its growing TVL (Total Value Locked) and the high organic interest in its decentralized perpetual exchange model.
‚ÄãAre you watching $HYPE for a potential breakout, or do you think the current range will hold?
